Hi! I'm James Lyddon and I'm a front-end web developer.

Who am I?

What do I know?

What have I done?

In a former life I was a Project Manager for Insight Global in California. I oversaw the mapping of the entire United States' public road network for Apple Maps using data collection vehicles to gather GPS, photo, and Lidar data.

I'll always be proud of the fact I started out as a driver in one of the collection vehicles and worked my way up to overseeing 200 vehicles and around 500 people but ultimately I wanted to do something more creative.

I initially got into coding as a hobby, writing C# scripts for games and mobile apps in Unity Engine. I'd been doing carpentry work while I figured out what I wanted to do next when the pandemic hit. I couldn't risk my wife catching Covid as she was pregnant so I took this opportunity to throw myself fully into learning to code, specifially web dev.

Since then I've built a solid foundation in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript ES6. I've worked with a lot of different libraries and frameworks but my main focus is on React. I'm pretty comfortable making static and dynamic apps myself but what I'm looking for is the opportunity to work with a team on larger projects.
